conclusion: The laser beam is injected at point O with an incident angle α = 45°.
The beam reflects at point A on the side of the optical fiber.
The angle between the incident ray and the normal to the surface at O is α = 45°.
The angle between the transmitted ray inside the fiber and the normal inside the fiber at A is θ.
Use Snell's Law to relate the angles in different media, focusing on the critical angle condition at A.
Total internal reflection happens when the angle of incidence inside the fiber is greater than the critical angle θc.
The critical angle θc is given by sin θc = n2/n1, where n1 is the refractive index of the core and n2 is that of the cladding (n1 > n2).
The incident angle at A is 90° - θ.
For total internal reflection, 90° - θ ≥ θc.
Since the beam enters at 45°, and total internal reflection occurs at the side, θ = 45°.
